HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Material to test EN15026 benchmark case

Since wood and wood-based products tend to swell and shrink, their material properties may depend on the current as well as preceding moisture contents. The applicability of WUFI has to be decided on a case-by-case basis. The measurements have been funded by the German Society for Wood Research (DGfH). Approximated Moisture Storage Function fitted to measured values at Phi= 0.8; 0.93; 1.0 Material: formaldehyd free Thickness: 15 mm measuremnet reference number H816_H (2003/2004) Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

Manufacturer: Adolf Wrth GmbH & Co. KG Reinhold-Wrth-Str. 12-17 D-74653 Knzelsau Tel.: 49 7940 15 3258 Fax: 49 7940 15 4208 timo.teulings@wuerth.com www.wuerth.de Source: TOUG, Test laboratory, Bratislava, SLO PB 90-10-0258 (2010) water vapour diffusion resistance factor (moisture-dependent) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement The membrane must be inserted with 1mm thickness ! Update March 2017: The name has changed. The formerly name of the product was "WTOP DB 2". Manufacturer's notes: WTOP DB 2 ist eine diffusionsfhige, feuchtregulierende, luftdichte und besonders verlegefreundliche Dampfbremse fr den Innen- und Dachausbau (sd-Wert = 2,52m).

effective material data membrane has to be inserted in component assembly using thickness of 1 mm! (SI-Units) Manufacturer: Adolf Wrth GmbH & Co. KG Reinhold-Wrth-Str. 12-17 D-74650 Knzelsau-Gaisbach Tel.: 49 7940 15 0 Fax: 49 7940 15 1000 Email: info@wuerth.com www.wuerth.de Source: MFPA Leipzig, laboratory report nr. PB 4.1/16-283-1 (2016) water vapour diffusion resistance factor (moisture-dependent) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Each cup measurement provides an average mu-value for the whole range of humidities existing in the material's cross section during the measurement. WUFI, however, needs an individual definite mu value for each definite humidity value. Therefore, the measurement results have been processed into a set of individual mu-values for appropriately selected individual humidity values, suitable for creating a table of moisture-dependent mu-values. Reproducibility of the measurements: 0% - 50% RH: measured: 4000, WUFI: 4000 0% - 75% RH: measured: 2400, WUFI: 2380 50% - 93% RH: measured: 640, WUFI: 639 Manufacturer's notes: The WTOP SD Vario is a diffusible, moisture-adaptive and airtight steam brake for the old building renovation, as well as the interior and roof construction. In combination with the Wtop underside and underneath lanes and the Eurasol adhesive tapes modern constructions can be executed according to the current EnEv.

Material.Name: Adolf Wrth, WTOP Thermo ND Plus

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: effective material data membrane has to be inserted in component assembly using thickness of 1 mm! (SI-Units) Manufacturer: Adolf Wrth GmbH & Co. KG Reinhold-Wrth-Str. 12-17 D-74650 Knzelsau-Gaisbach Tel.: 49 7940 15 0 Fax: 49 7940 15 1000 Email: info@wuerth.com www.wuerth.de Source: IBP laboratory test HoFM-35/2015 (Sep 12, 2015) bulk density water vapour diffusion resistance factor (wet-cup) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Update March 2017: The name has changed. The formerly name of the product was "WTOP Thermo ND Plus". Manufacturer's notes: Die Polyester Dachbahn WTOP Thermo ND Plus mit geprfter Schlagregendichtheit fr eine naht- und perforationsgesicherte Unterdeckung bzw. Unterspannung ohne zustzliches Nageldichtmaterial, kann als erstes System am Markt eine Temperaturbestndigkeit im System von 120++C vorweisen. Durch die Einfhrung der 1. europisch technischen Bewertung ETA-17/0206 im Steildach, kann die WTOP Thermo ND Plus dieses Qualittsversprechen untermauern. Diese ETA regelt rechtssicher die Anwendung dieser Bahn, ohne zustzliches Nageldichtmaterial fr die Anwendung auf vollflchiger druckfester Auflage, am Befestigungspunkt als naht- und perforationsgesicherte Unterdeckung bzw. Unterspannung.

Material.Name: AiF ETICS/EIFS Board WF high density

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Generic data set for external thermal insulation composite systems (ETICS) WF according to EN 13171 for humid environment, exterior insulation of wall assemblies (according to the German Standard DIN 4108-10: WAP). Density range about 140 to 260 kg/m; thickness range about 20 to 80 mm The measurements of the material data and the preparation of the generic data sets were conducted within the AiF-funded Project Entwicklung von Modellen zur Generierung hygrothermischer Kennwerte von Holzwerkstoffen zur numerischen Simulation des Bauteilverhaltens in 2016 (Nr. 484-ZN). Material data based on the models developed within the research project: - Bulk Density: 260 kg/m (Maximum value of the density range) - Porosity: 1 Bulk Density/1500 [m/m] - Spec. Heat Capacity: 1400 J/kgK (dry value; WUFI automatically considers the moisture dependency as a function of water content) - Thermal Conductivity: Lambda = 0,03046 * e^(0,00194*Bulk Density) [W/mK] - Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor: model according to [Rther, N.: Simulationsmodelle zur numerischen Berechnung des Widerstandes bei Wasserdampfdiffusion in Holzwerkstoffen. Abschlussbericht des AiF-Forschungsvorhabens 16043 N. 2012] - Moisture Storage Function: Moisture Storage Function based on u50, u65, u80, u93, u97 and uf values (u50, u65, u80, u93, u97): sorption moisture for spruce according to Keylwerth ([M.-%]), converted according to the bulk density of the material Free Water Saturation: uf = 10*u97 (with uf = 0,95*umax) - Water Absorption Coefficient: critical value from the measurement range - Liquid Transport Coefficient, Suction: based on A-value, u80 and uf - Liquid Transport Coefficient, Redistribution: DWW = DWS Further details on the models can be found in the research report. Wood-based materials are natural products and therefore are subject to a certain fluctuation margin. The material data can vary up to +/-20 % caused by the raw materials. If there is a sensitive reaction to specific values, in single cases a parameter study can be necessary. The generic data sets can be used for evaluation of constructions and the results should be representative in most cases. Especially in the case of favorable hygrothermal conditions the differences between the generic and the specific materials should remain small. This could be shown by many comparative calculations within the project. In case of results near or above critical limit values (e.g. 18 or 20 M.-% resp. 95 % RH) moisture levels in specific materials could deviate in both directions from the results with the generic data. In that case the construction should be optimized to achieve normal and more favorable hygrothermal conditions. If its not possible to optimize the construction in that way, specific material data for the real products are required for a more detailed evaluation. Because of swelling and shrinking the data of wood-based materials depend to a certain extent on their present and past moisture content. Therefore the applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be decided case by case.

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Generic data set for external thermal insulation composite systems (ETICS) WF according to EN 13171 for humid environment, exterior insulation of wall assemblies (according to the German Standard DIN 4108-10: WAP). Generic data set for wood-fiber insulation boards WF according to EN 13171 for dry environment, cavity insulation of roof and wall assemblies (according to the German Standard DIN 4108-10: DZ, WZ). Density range about 45 to 60 kg/m; thickness range about 40 to 240 mm The measurements of the material data and the preparation of the generic data sets were conducted within the AiF-funded Project Entwicklung von Modellen zur Generierung hygrothermischer Kennwerte von Holzwerkstoffen zur numerischen Simulation des Bauteilverhaltens in 2016 (Nr. 484-ZN). Material data based on the models developed within the research project: - Bulk Density: 50 kg/m (Average value of the density range) - Porosity: 1 Bulk Density/1500 [m/m] - Spec. Heat Capacity: 1400 J/kgK (dry value; WUFI automatically considers the moisture dependency as a function of water content) - Thermal Conductivity: lambda = 0,03046 * e^(0,00194*Bulk Density) [W/mK] - Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor: model according to [Rther, N.: Simulationsmodelle zur numerischen Berechnung des Widerstandes bei Wasserdampfdiffusion in Holzwerkstoffen. Heat Capacity: 1400 J/kgK (dry value; WUFI automatically considers the moisture dependency as a function of water content) - Thermal Conductivity: Lambda = 0,03046 * e^(0,00194*Bulk Density) [W/mK] - Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor: model according to [Rther, N.: Simulationsmodelle zur numerischen Berechnung des Widerstandes bei Wasserdampfdiffusion in Holzwerkstoffen. Wood-based materials are natural products and therefore are subject to a certain fluctuation margin. The material data can vary up to +/-20 % caused by the raw materials. If there is a sensitive reaction to specific values, in single cases a parameter study can be necessary. The generic data sets can be used for evaluation of constructions and the results should be representative in most cases. This could be shown by many comparative calculations within the project. In that case the construction should be optimized to achieve normal and more favorable hygrothermal conditions. If its not possible to optimize the construction in that way, specific material data for the real products are required for a more detailed evaluation. Because of swelling and shrinking the data of wood-based materials depend to a certain extent on their present and past moisture content. Therefore the applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be decided case by case. +-values derived from cup measurements determine average +-values for the respective moisture ranges (e.g. 50% - 80% RH). For the tabulation in WUFI, the +-values of the material for specific moisture contents have been derived, using a fitting procedure.

In that case the construction should be optimized to achieve normal and more favorable hygrothermal conditions. If its not possible to optimize the construction in that way, specific material data for the real products are required for a more detailed evaluation. Because of swelling and shrinking the data of wood-based materials depend to a certain extent on their present and past moisture content. Therefore the applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be decided case by case.

Material.Name: AiF Rigid Underlay Board WF high density

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Generic data set for underlay boards made of wood-fiber insulation WF according to EN 13171, type UDP-A. Density range about 180 to 270 kg/m; thickness range about 20 to 60 mm The measurements of the material data and the preparation of the generic data sets were conducted within the AiF-funded Project Entwicklung von Modellen zur Generierung hygrothermischer Kennwerte von Holzwerkstoffen zur numerischen Simulation des Bauteilverhaltens in 2016 (Nr. 484-ZN). Material data based on the models developed within the research project: - Bulk Density: 270 kg/m (Maximum value of the density range) - Porosity: 1 Bulk Density/1500 [m/m] - Spec. Heat Capacity: 1400 J/kgK (dry value; WUFI automatically considers the moisture dependency as a function of water content) - Thermal Conductivity: Lambda = 0,03046 * e^(0,00194*Bulk Density) [W/mK] - Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor: model according to [Rther, N.: Simulationsmodelle zur numerischen Berechnung des Widerstandes bei Wasserdampfdiffusion in Holzwerkstoffen. Abschlussbericht des AiF-Forschungsvorhabens 16043 N. 2012] - Moisture Storage Function: Moisture Storage Function based on u50, u65, u80, u93, u97 and uf values (u50, u65, u80, u93, u97): sorption moisture for spruce according to Keylwerth ([M.-%]), converted according to the bulk density of the material Free Water Saturation: uf = 10*u97 (with uf = 0,95*umax) - Water Absorption Coefficient: critical value from the measurement range - Liquid Transport Coefficient, Suction: based on A-value, u80 and uf - Liquid Transport Coefficient, Redistribution: DWW = DWS Further details on the models can be found in the research report. Wood-based materials are natural products and therefore are subject to a certain fluctuation margin. The material data can vary up to +/-20 % caused by the raw materials. If there is a sensitive reaction to specific values, in single cases a parameter study can be necessary. The generic data sets can be used for evaluation of constructions and the results should be representative in most cases. Especially in the case of favorable hygrothermal conditions the differences between the generic and the specific materials should remain small. This could be shown by many comparative calculations within the project. In case of results near or above critical limit values (e.g. 18 or 20 M.-% resp. 95 % RH) moisture levels in specific materials could deviate in both directions from the results with the generic data. In that case the construction should be optimized to achieve normal and more favorable hygrothermal conditions. If its not possible to optimize the construction in that way, specific material data for the real products are required for a more detailed evaluation. Because of swelling and shrinking the data of wood-based materials depend to a certain extent on their present and past moisture content. Therefore the applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be decided case by case.

Manufacturer: ISOCELL GmbH Bahnhofstrasse 36 A-5202 Neumarkt am Wallersee www.isocell.at Source: Tabelled mu-values fitted to cup measurements of MFPA Leibzig provided by the manufacturer, laboratory report nr PB 4.1/12-287-1 v. 13.Juli 2012 water vapour diffusion resistance factor (moisture-dependent) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement The membrane must be inserted with a thickness of 1mm ! Each cup measurement provides an average mu-value for the whole range of humidities existing in the material's cross section during measurement. WUFI, however, needs an individual definite mu value for each definite humidity value. Therefore, the measurement results have been processed into a set of individual mu-values for appropriately selected individual humidity values, suitable for creating a table of moisture-dependent mu-values. Reproducibility of the measurements: 0% - 50% RH: measured: 20480, WUFI: 20479.6 0% - 75% RH: measured: 10680, WUFI: 10675.1 33% - 67% RH: measured: 10960, WUFI: 10958.6 50% - 81% RH: measured: 2690, WUFI: 2687.3 65% - 95% RH: measured: 320, WUFI: 319.8 83% - 97% RH: measured: 162, WUFI: 162.0 Manufacturer's notes: Airstop DIVA FORTE ist eine feuchtevariable Dampfbremse fr die Ausfhrung der luftdichten Ebene. Die AIRSTOP DIVA FORTE reagiert auf Umgebungsfeuchte. Der SD-Wert verndert sich je nach klimatischen Bedingungen zwischen 0,2 und 12 m. Dadurch wird eine hohe Rcktrocknung von Feuchtigkeit mglich.

Manufacturer: ASPEN AEROGELS, INC. 30 Forbes Road, Building B Northborough, MA 01532 USA Tel: 1.508.691.1111 Fax: 1.508.691.1200 tel+ 353 86 4114677 tel. +49 751 957911 Email: info@aerogel.com www.aerogel.com Source: IBP laboratory test F099 (2012) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test - capillary back transport test for capillary-active (interior) insulating materials (NMR measurements) Manufacturer's notes: Spaceloft is an Ultra-thin Fibre Reinforced aerogel blanket insulation manufactured in 5mm or 10mm thicknesses. Spaceloft is Vapour permeable & hydrophobic has a Euroclass C-s1-d0 fire performance and allows up to 20% visible light transmission Density: 150kgs /m3 Colour: White or Grey ETA available 11_0471 Spaceloft can be used as a space saving insulation throughout the building envelope particularly in heritage projects. Primary uses include internal wall insulation, external wall insulation, floor and roof insulation and as a treatment for thermal bridging. Declared Thermal conductivity is 0.014 W//mK @ 10 deg C. Operating range -50 deg C to +200 Deg C Example: Full installation instructions for a wide variety of applications available on our website www.aerogel.com or on request to info@aerogel.com, include WUFI in the subject field.

Concrete screed To be composed of three layers, from top to bottom: - Concrete Screed, top layer, - Concrete Screed, mid layer, - Concrete Screed, bottom layer After installation of the concrete screed, some segregation will take place, leading to different material properties in the top and bottom parts of the screed layer. Sedimentation will cause higher density in the bottom region. Accumulation of cement slurry in the top region will cause a lower diffusion resistance. For a differentiated measurement of the material properties, the screed layer was divided into three layers of equal thickness which were measured separately. Therefore, in a simulation a screed layer should be divided into three sub-layers of equal thickness which are assigned the respective material data for the top, middle and bottom part. Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

Sedimentation will cause higher density in the bottom region. Accumulation of cement slurry in the top region will cause a lower diffusion resistance. For a differentiated measurement of the material properties, the screed layer was divided into three layers of equal thickness which were measured separately. Therefore, in a simulation a screed layer should be divided into three sub-layers of equal thickness which are assigned the respective material data for the top, middle and bottom part. water/cement ratio = 0.5 G.Hedenblad: Moisture permeability of mature concrete, cement mortar and cement paste. PhD Thesis, Lund (Sweden) Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement With respect to the overall moisture transmission, this concrete is roughly equivalent to waterproof types of concrete (appropriate thickness and reinforcement required). This means that the amount of moisture transported across the concrete layer is modelled quite realistically. However, the moisture distribution across the concrete, which shows a pronounced profile because of self-sealing effects due to moisture-induced swelling in the pore spaces, can not be simulated with constant material parameters as used here.
References: Lambda after measurements from Cammerer, J; Achtziger, J: FIW Mnchen Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

Calcium sulfate screed To be composed of two layers, from top to bottom: - CaSO4 Screed, top layer - CaSO4 Screed, bottom layer After installation of the calcium sulfate screed, some segregation will take place, leading to different material properties in the top and bottom parts of the screed layer. Sedimentation will cause higher density in the bottom region. Accumulation of calcium sulfate slurry in the top region will cause lower density. For a differentiated measurement of the material properties, the screed layer was divided into two layers of equal thickness which were measured separately. Therefore, in a simulation a screed layer should be divided into two sub-layers of equal thickness which are assigned the respective material data for the top and bottom part. Z-9.1-853 (2015) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Manufacturer's notes: Reinforced vapour check and airtightness membrane made of building paper, humidity-variable. Can be used as a vapour retarder and airtightness membrane for all exterior permeable structures in roofs, ceilings and walls, in combination, for example, with pro clima SOLITEX membranes, softwood fibreboard or MDF board. For external, impermeable, flat and pitched roof structures. For green roofs, INTESANA and INTELLO membranes offer a higher level of protection against structural damage. Further information is given by study "Calculation of the potential freedom from structural damage of thermal insulation structures in timber-built and steel systems".

Manufacturer: Poratec GmbH Industriestra+e 13 D-96120 Bischberg-Trosdorf Tel.: 09503-4841 Fax: 09503-4824 Email: info@poratec.de Source: IBP laboratory report HoFM-33 /2012 (August 2012) moisture storage function based on measured values (50%, 80%, 93%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - capillary back transport test for capillary-active (interior) insulating materials (NMR measurements) Manufacturer's notes: Anwendungsgebiet gem+ Zulassung ETA -05/0179 fr: - Innendmmung von Wnden - Innendmmung von Decken und Dchern

Thermal cork based Plaster Manufacturer: DIASEN srl Zona Industriale Berbentina 5 60041 Sassoferrato (AN) - ITALIA Tel.: 0039 0732 9718 Fax: 0039 0732 971899 Email: diasen@diasen.com www.diasen.com Source: Meccano, Report Nr. 023316, 024210 (2011-2016) moisture storage function based on measured values (0%, 20%, 30%, 40%, 50%, 60%, 70%, 80%, 90%, 95%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test The liquid transport coefficients for suction (Dws) are defined based on the measured water absorption coefficient (A value). Since the A value was measured according to the standard EN1015-18, which tends to lead to higher values than the test procedure from EN ISO 15148:2003 which better represents the real rain water absorption of the facade, also the Dws are accordingly higher. As a result, more water can be absorbed and be transported more quickly within the material as in the real situation, especially when "Diathonite Evolution" is applied without additional rain protection. For the use of the material on the exterior, this approach should normally be on the safe side. Manufacturer's notes: Premixed plaster, fiber-reinforced with cork (grain size 0 - 3 mm 0 - 0.12 in), clay, diatomaceous earth and natural hydraulic lime NHL 3.5. Natural eco-friendly thermal compound, totally cement-free and highly breathable, ready to use, for external thermal insulation and for indoor and outdoor dehumidification. CE and LEED marked. It is the only product that sums up cold insulation features of cork and heat insulation features of stones. The product has good fire reaction and it is recyclable as inert. Its porosity and the presence of lime make it extremely breathable, bacteriostatic and anti-mould.

Manufacturer: elka-Holzwerke GmbH Hochwaldstrasse 44 D-54497 Morbach Tel.: 06533-956-0 Fax: 06533-956-220 Email: info@elka-holzwerke.de www.esb-platte.de Source: IBP laboratory test F122 (2013) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test Manufacturer's notes: elka-esb P5: the alternative to OSB with low water diffusibility, with sanded surface, available in different dimensions, thicknesses and straight edge or T&G Update Feb 18, 2016: Because of a modified chip shape the water vapour diffusion resistance factor (+-value) has changed to 80 (Dry-Cup) and 40 (Wet-Cup). Manufacturer: Eternit AG Knesebeckstr. 59-61 D-10719 Berlin Contact Person: Armin Stark, Head of Department Technik Fassade und Ausbau Tel.: +49 (0) 30 3485-279 Fax: +49 (0) 30 3485-282 Armin.Stark@eternit.de www.eternit.de Source: IBP laboratory test F109 (2013) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test Manufacturer's notes: Autoclaved fiber cement The material consists of 13% Portland cement, ca 15% fillers, ca 15% cellulose, ca 16% quartz sand, ca 5% mica and ca 3% calcium silicate as well as ca 28% microscopic small air_pure spaces and ca 5% water. Autoclave fiber cement hardens under vapor pressure in an autoclave. Portland cement is produced from limestone and clay according to EN 197-1. Cellulose is used as filter fiber and prevents the flushing of cement particles. Quartz sand is used as internal filler and calcium silicate as reinforcing filler. Mica reduces the hygric movement. The independent German Institute for Building and Environment weighted the fiber cement as an ecological and healthy building material. Update 20.10.2015: Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor, moisture-dependent: RH 0,75 -> RH 0,715

Manufacturer: Eternit AG Knesebeckstr. 59-61 D-10719 Berlin Contact Person: Armin Stark, Head of Department Technik Fassade und Ausbau Tel.: +49 (0) 30 3485-279 Fax: +49 (0) 30 3485-282 Armin.Stark@eternit.de www.eternit.de Source: IBP laboratory test F109 (2013) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test Thickness: 10 mm to 32 mm Plates with other thicknesses than the thickness of 19 mm listed in the database may have different material properties than the measured specimen, due to the inhomogeneous structure of the plate. Manufacturer's notes: Wood-cement-boards As modern and ecological building material the wood-cement consists of ca 40% wood fibers from spruce and fir, ca 19% Portland cement, ca 10% water, ca 4% air_pure, ca 24% perlite and ca 3% ecologic mineral compounds. Portland cement is produced from limestone and clay according to EN 197-1. Wood-cement is produced in a special production line. This guarantee a constant strength and density for the highest quality. In the production process there are 0%-waste of the wood-cement-raw mixture because of material recycling. The independent German Institute for Building and Environment weighted the wood-cement as biological harmless. Update 10/2015: Water Vapour Diffusion Resistance Factor, moisture-dependent: RH 0,5 -> RH 0,715 Update 03/2017: Porosity has been raised from 0.345 to 0.36 in order to increase the distance between free and maximum saturation for improved numerical treatment.

Material.Name: EVALON V, VG, VSK, VGSK (sd=26 m)

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: effective material data membrane has to be inserted in component assembly using thickness of 1 mm! (SI-Units) The real thickness of the membrane is 1.2 mm. The database contains an effective diffusion resistance factor (+-value) converted to a thickness of 1 mm. Manufacturer: alwitra GmbH & Co. Am Forst 1 54296 Trier Tel.: 049 651 9102-0 Fax: 049 651 9102-500 Email: alwitra@alwitra.de www.alwitra.de Source: IBP laboratory test F223 (2016) water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup) bulk density material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Short-Wave Radiation Absorptivity: 0.20 / 0.62 / 0.91 Long-Wave Radiation Emissivity: 0.9 These values can be selected as surface transfer coefficients in the corresponding list (Entry: "Alwitra EVALON white" / "Alwitra EVALON gray" / "Alwitra EVALON graphitegray"). Manufacturer's notes: EVALON is a bitumen compatible, standardized EVA synthetic - waterproofing membrane with backing. The high-quality membranes are characterized by a balance of stability and elasticity and are suitable for all single-ply waterproofing applications. The unproblematic installation in conjunction with the numerous system components enables secure and durable sealing. EVA membranes have proved for over 45 years in practice. EVALON V Backing: polyester fleece backing Installation Types: loose laying with ballast (gravel, paving slabs, roof garden); mechanically fastening or bonded application EVALON VG Fulfills the fire protection requirements even directly on unbacked rigid PS foam boards. Backing: glass/polyester fleece backing Installation Types: loose laying with ballast (gravel, paving slabs, roof garden); mechanically fastening or bonded application EVALON VSK Backing: polyester fleece backing and self-adhesive coating Installation Type: bonded (self-adhesive coating) EVALON VGSK Fulfills the fire protection requirements even directly on unbacked rigid EPS foam boards. Backing: glass/polyester fleece backing and self-adhesive coating Installation Type: bonded (self-adhesive coating)

Manufacturer: Deutsche Foamglas GmbH Itterpark 1 40724 Hilden Tel.: 2103249570 Fax: 21032495735 Email: info@foamglas.de http://www.foamglas.com Source: Z1-011.0-01-01/15 (FIW, 2015) bulk density material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement The value 0.05 W/mK for the thermal conductivity is the 'Declare-Value' specified by the manufacturer. The controlled boundary value given by the certificate of compliance Reg.No. Z1-011.0-01-01/15 (FIW) is 0.0499 W/mK. Manufacturer's notes: FOAMGLAS is a high-quality thermal insulation material for structural engineering and for technical operating plants. The insulation is manufactured primarily from recycled glass (> 66%) and natural raw materials that occur almost without limit in nature. With the recycling of glass, FOAMGLAS makes an important ecological contribution. Both sides of the insulation board are lined with a glass fibre facing. FOAMGLAS characteristics: Waterproof Vermin-proof Compression-proof Fire and fumes Vapour control Dimensionally stable Acid and chemical resistant Easy to cut Ecological

Manufacturer: Massivholz Junker GmbH Ludwig-Junker-Platz 1 77738 Nordrach Tel.: 07838-207 Fax: 07838-781 Email: info@massivholz-junker.de www.massivholz-junker.de Source: Moisture storage function: Derived from a combination of measured moisture storage functions of comparable types of solid wood and measured data from literature. Water vapor diffusion resistance factor (+-value): The tabulated +-values have been derived from effective +-values determined by cup measurements (source: HFB Engineering GmbH, Laboratory Report Nr.: 311002362/1/2016). The scatter of the measured effective values ranges from 142 to 247 (dry cup) and from 11 to 31 (wet cup). Liquid transport coefficients: The variability of the tabulated +-values also allows for simplified liquid transport. For thin material slabs not exposed to weather, combining vapor and liquid transport in this approximative way is well justified because they only experience small temperature gradients. The data set does not take into account modifications of the material parameters caused by swelling and shrinking of the wood which may occur during wetting or drying processes. There may be cases where these effects should not be ignored. Manufacturer's notes: The new GFM Panel (a glue-free massive wood panel) allows all-round applications in a wide variety of sectors! You can rely on this absolutely environmentally-compatible material to give you a healthy and natural indoor climate.

Because of their swelling and shrinking the material data of wood and processed wood materials depend on their present and past moisture content. The applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be judged case by case. Hardwood / softwood: These material data are primarily meant for the calculation of diffusion processes (data set without liquid transport coefficients; liquid transport modelled by variable mu-value). To be used in cases without capillary water uptake by the wood, e.g. for drying-out of roof boards and for similar wood layers which are not directly exposed to weather. Oak/spruce radial/longitudinal: The liquid transport coefficients have been determined from the moisture behaviour of specimens exposed to natural weather. The moisture-dependence of the mu-value is already included in the liqid transport coefficients. Dww has been set equal to Dws in order to describe swelling phenomena. Great dependence on swelling condition! To be used for wooden parts in direct contact with rain water (e.g. framework constructions) and for analysing drying processes at high moisture contents. Should, however, be used with caution and only for approximative calculations, because of large uncertainties. Radial: transport perpendicular to fibers. Longitudinal: transport along the fibers. Sources for hardwood (e.g. oak, beech): Bulk density, porosity, specific heat capacity, thermal conductivity dry, thermal conductivity supplement: Kollmann: "Technologie des Holzes und der Holzwerkstoffe" Vapour diffusion resistance factor: IEA Annex 14 Catalogue (above 0.9: estimated) Moisture storage function: standard function for wood materials Temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement: default value.

Loose fill insulation (wood shavings) Source: IBP Approximationmethods for transport coefficients used Current research work is focused on the moisture related thermal conductivity supplement of this material. Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

Manufacturer's notes: If the ratio d / n is less than 3, the variable + value must not be used. In this ratio d is the board thickness in cm and n is the number of the glue joints.

Material.Name: Misapor 10/50, load-bearing insulation under foundation slabs

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Manufacturer: Misapor Management AG Fuggerstr.10 D-41468 Neuss Telefon: +49 2131 7398720 Fax: +49 2131 7398799 Schroteln 4 D-78073 Bad Drrheim Telefon: +49 7726 378 888 0 Fax: +49 7726 378 888 10 Email: sekretariat.deutschland@misapor.com www.misapor.de Source: IBP laboratory test F069 (2011) Moisture storage function based on the moisture content measured at 80% RH and the free saturation specified by the building inspectorates approval. Additional points have been interpolated with the 3-point formula. The remaining material properties have been provided by the manufacturer. This data set is intended for the usual kind of application of the material which entails a certain moisture content of the loose fill. Therefore, the thermal conductivity is the design value (as specified by the building inspectorate DIBts approval, assuming that the material has been installed in a moist state). When it can be expected that due to ist placement in the wall assembly or a sheltered exposure situation the material remains reliably and permanently dry (e.g. when used for an interior retrofit measure), the data set "sheltered or interior application" should be used. That data set contains the measured dry thermal conductivity of the material, which - if needed - may be suitably increased at the users discretion in order to reflect the simulated objects moisture state and situation. Manufacturer's notes: Mit seiner hohen Druckfestigkeit kann Misapor 10/50 berall eingesetzt werden: Als lastabtragende Wrmedmmung gegen das Erdreich mit hoher Belastung und auf unterkellerten, befahr- oder begehbaren Gebudeteilen sowie im Stra+enbau. Die Dmmwirkung kann auch im Rohrleitungsbau genutzt werden.

When it can be expected that due to ist placement in the wall assembly or a sheltered exposure situation the material remains reliably and permanently dry (e.g. when used for an interior retrofit measure), the data set "sheltered or interior application" should be used. That data set contains the measured dry thermal conductivity of the material, which - if needed - may be suitably increased at the users discretion in order to reflect the simulated objects moisture state and situation. Manufacturer's notes: Als lastabtragende Wrmedmmung gegen das Erdreich mit normaler Belastung und als Leichtschttung fr Dcher, befahrbare Tiefgaragen, Sttzmauerhinterfllungen, Bschungsgestaltungen, Bausanierungen etc. Misapor Wall-Bag-System: Als Wall-Bag dmmt der Schaumglasschotter auch vertikale Gebudeteile wie etwa Kellerwnde. Im Hinblick auf eine wohngesunde, energieoptimierte, wrmebrckenfreie Bauweise eine geradezu optimale Lsung. Die mit Misapor Schaumglasschotter gefllten Gewebe-Bags umschliessen als thermische Dmmung die Kellerwnde. Das Handling ist Misapor-typisch sehr einfach: Die Wall-Bags werden nur leicht an den Wnden fixiert und die fertig konfektionierten Kammern anschliessend befllt - so knnen auch bei bestehenden Immobilien Kellersanierungen kostengnstig und zeitsparend ausgefhrt werden.

Because of their swelling and shrinking the material data of wood and processed wood materials depend on their present and past moisture content. The applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be judged case by case. Hardwood / softwood: These material data are primarily meant for the calculation of diffusion processes (data set without liquid transport coefficients; liquid transport modelled by variable mu-value). To be used in cases without capillary water uptake by the wood, e.g. for drying-out of roof boards and for similar wood layers which are not directly exposed to weather. Oak/spruce radial/longitudinal: The liquid transport coefficients have been determined from the moisture behaviour of specimens exposed to natural weather. The moisture-dependence of the mu-value is already included in the liqid transport coefficients. Dww has been set equal to Dws in order to describe swelling phenomena. Great dependence on swelling condition! To be used for wooden parts in direct contact with rain water (e.g. framework constructions) and for analysing drying processes at high moisture contents. Should, however, be used with caution and only for approximative calculations, because of large uncertainties. Radial: transport perpendicular to fibers. Longitudinal: transport along the fibers. Source for oak longitudinal: Vik, T. A.: "Bestimmung geeigneter feuchtetechnischer Stoffeigenschaften von Holz und Berechnung des Feuchtehaushaltes unter Verwendung der ermittelten Kennwerte". Diploma thesis, 1996 Temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement: default value.

Because of their swelling and shrinking the material data of wood and processed wood materials depend on their present and past moisture content. The applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be judged case by case. Hardwood / softwood: These material data are primarily meant for the calculation of diffusion processes (data set without liquid transport coefficients; liquid transport modelled by variable mu-value). To be used in cases without capillary water uptake by the wood, e.g. for drying-out of roof boards and for similar wood layers which are not directly exposed to weather. Oak/spruce radial/longitudinal: The liquid transport coefficients have been determined from the moisture behaviour of specimens exposed to natural weather. The moisture-dependence of the mu-value is already included in the liqid transport coefficients. Dww has been set equal to Dws in order to describe swelling phenomena. Great dependence on swelling condition! To be used for wooden parts in direct contact with rain water (e.g. framework constructions) and for analysing drying processes at high moisture contents. Should, however, be used with caution and only for approximative calculations, because of large uncertainties. Radial: transport perpendicular to fibers. Longitudinal: transport along the fibers. Source for oak radial: Vik, T. A.: "Bestimmung geeigneter feuchtetechnischer Stoffeigenschaften von Holz und Berechnung des Feuchtehaushaltes unter Verwendung der ermittelten Kennwerte". Diploma thesis, 1996 Temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement: default value.

Natural sandstones generally exhibit large variations in their material properties. References: moisture storage curve,Dww,Dws: Krus, M.: Moisture Transport and Storage Coefficients of Porous Mineral Building Materials. Fraunhofer IRB Verlag (1996). Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

Since wood and wood-based products tend to swell and shrink, their material properties may depend on the current as well as preceding moisture contents. The applicability of WUFI has to be decided on a case-by-case basis. The measurements have been funded by the German Society for Wood Research (DGfH). Approximated Moisture Storage Function fitted to measured values at Phi= 0.8; 0.93; 1.0 Material:OSB formaldehyde free (EN 300) Thickness: 30 mm measurement reference number H816_Q (2003/2004) Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Update 03/2017: Porosity has been raised from 0.61 to 0.64 in order to increase the distance between free and maximum saturation for improved numerical treatment.

Since wood and wood-based products tend to swell and shrink, their material properties may depend on the current as well as preceding moisture contents. Manufacturer: SAKRET GmbH Osterhagener Stra+e 2 37431 Bad Lauterberg Tel.: 03631 929-300 Fax: 03631 929-403 Email: info@sakret-gmbh.de www.sakret-gmbh.de Source: IBP laboratory test F111_B (2012) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) *) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test *) - drying test *) *) The material parameters provided in this data set do not include liquid transport coefficients and are thus appropriate for indoor use of the material (where it is not exposed to rain). Indoors, the material will usually remain sufficiently dry so that no liquid water transport needs to be taken into account. Significant wetting of the material will only occur in cases of flooding, burst pipes etc., which cause long-term exposure of the material to liquid water. It may be expected that after extended exposure to water, swelling of the material will markedly reduce liquid transport and finally stop it altogether. Therefore, both of these two very different indoor cases can be modelled using these material data. Exposure to rain would cause short-term wetting and drying with higher liquid transport fluxes which would require appropriate liquid transport coefficients. Thermal conductivity design value: <= 0.45 for P=50% <= 0.49 for P=90% Manufacturer's notes: base coat and finishing coat for SAKRET capillary suction system (Internal Thermal Insulation Composite System)

Manufacturer: SmartPly Europe Ltd Belview, Slieverue X91 PX75 Waterford, Ireland Tel.: 00353 51 851 233 Fax: 00353 51 851 130 Email: info@coillte.com www.smartply.com Source: IBP test report P1-201e/2015 moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test - redistribution test The value 0.1000 W/mK for the thermal conductivity is the 'Declare-Value' specified by the manufacturer. The measured value given by P1-201e/2015 is 0.0981 W/mK. Manufacturer's notes: SmartPly VapAirTight is a structural OSB panel with integrated vapour control and air_pure barrier properties for use as structural sheathing in timber frame structures. A patent is pending for SmartPly VapAirTight. Airtightness is engineered into the OSB panel substrate, whilst SmartPly's inhouse speciality surfacing technology provides an integrated vapour barrier with consistently high vapour resistance over the entire surface. The coating also provides a smooth durable surface for superior bonding of airtight tape at panel joints. SmartPly VapAirTight provides a sustainable and robust alternative to specialist AVCL membranes which are prone to damage by site trades during the construction process. The product is suitable for both new build and renovation projects.

Because of their swelling and shrinking the material data of wood and processed wood materials depend on their present and past moisture content. The applicability of these data for WUFI calculations has to be judged case by case. Hardwood / softwood: These material data are primarily meant for the calculation of diffusion processes (data set without liquid transport coefficients; liquid transport modelled by variable mu-value). To be used in cases without capillary water uptake by the wood, e.g. for drying-out of roof boards and for similar wood layers which are not directly exposed to weather. Oak/spruce radial/longitudinal: The liquid transport coefficients have been determined from the moisture behaviour of specimens exposed to natural weather. The moisture-dependence of the mu-value is already included in the liqid transport coefficients. Dww has been set equal to Dws in order to describe swelling phenomena. Great dependence on swelling condition! To be used for wooden parts in direct contact with rain water (e.g. framework constructions) and for analysing drying processes at high moisture contents. Should, however, be used with caution and only for approximative calculations, because of large uncertainties. Radial: transport perpendicular to fibers. Longitudinal: transport along the fibers. Sources for softwood (e.g. spruce): Bulk density, porosity, specific heat capacity, thermal conductivity dry, thermal conductivity supplement: Kollmann: "Technologie des Holzes und der Holzwerkstoffe" Vapour diffusion resistance factor: IEA Annex 14 Catalogue (above 0.7: estimated, using diploma thesis Kaufmann). Moisture storage function: standard function for wood materials Temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement: default value.

Manufacturer: STEICO SE Otto-Lilienthal-Ring 30 85622 Feldkirchen Germany Tel.: +49 - (0)89 - 99 15 51 - 0 Fax: +49 - (0)89 - 99 15 51 - 99 Email: info@steico.com www.steico.com Source: IBP laboratory test F055 (2016) moisture storage function based on measured values (65%, 80%, 93%, 97%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard value for moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test Manufacturer's notes: point free insulation very good thermal insulation and thermal storage capacity excellent summer heat protection water vapour open for a healthy internal climate particularly slump resistant due to interlooking wood fibres no additional on-site cutting high quality through trained installers recyclable, pure wood fibres from pine optimum sound protection when combined with STEICO rigid insulation boards

Manufacturer: Sto AG Ehrenbachstra+e 1 79780 Sthlingen www.sto.de Contact: Infoservice Phone: +49 (0)7744 - 571020 Fax: +49 (0)7744 - 572020 infoservice@stoeu.com Material data are based on measurements by TU Dresden, except Liquid transport coefficients: approximated by IBP (and still subject to ongoing research) Heat capacity: estimated by IBP Heat conductivity: provided by manufacturer Manufacturer's notes: Naturally insulating: Perlite The vitreous volcanic mineral perlite exhibits excellent heat insulation and sound absorption, and readily disperses any interstitial moisture. Perlite is derived from obsidian, a naturally occurring volcanic glass with permanently renewed natural sources, thus qualifiying as a sustainable resource. The thermal insulation board made from natural perlite is not flammable, not hydrophobic, vapor-permeable and moisture-dispersing. The board thickness is variable depending on the required insulation quality.

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Manufacturer: Baur Vliesstoffe GmbH Schulfeldstr. 4 91550 Dinkelsbhl-Sinbronn Deutschland Tel.: +49 (0) 09851/3041 Fax: +49 (0) 09851/7875 Email: info@thermalan.de / info@swisswool.ch / info@tirolwool.at www.thermalan.com / www.swisswool.ch / www.tirolwool.at Source: ECOLABOR, laboratory report nr. ECO-P11013-10059 (18/11/2011) moisture storage function based on measured values (2%, 10%, 20%, 35%, 50%, 65%, 80%, 90%, 95%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup) bulk density porosity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Manufacturer's notes: thermalan iso / swisswool iso / tirolwool iso ist eine eigensteife Dmmplatte aus permanent mottengeschtzter Schafwolle, mit Polyester thermisch verfestigt, zum Einsatz als Wrme- und Schalldmmung, sowie zum Feuchte- und Schadstoffmanagement bei Holzstnderkonstruktionen. Schafwolle ist wasserabweisend, kann aber sehr schnell bis zu 30% des Eigengewichtes an Luftfeuchte sorbieren. Dabei handelt es sich nicht um eine kapillare Aufnahme, sondern die Feuchtigkeit reagiert exotherm mit der Wollfaser, soda+ die Faser trocken bleibt. Die geringe Wrmeleitfhigkeit bleibt auch bei Sttigung erhalten.

Generic vacuum insulation panel Effective material parameters: A vacuum insulation panel (VIP) consists of an air_pure-tight membrane wrapped around an evacuated porous insulating core material. For a hygrothermal simulation, this composition of the panel is not relevant - the panel as a whole behaves as a vapor-tight layer with given thermal conductivity and negligible water content. Note: The heat conductivity given here is only valid for the undamaged, airtight panel. If the vacuum has been broken, the heat conductivity will rise to about 0.02 W/mK.

Manufacturer: WOLFIN Bautechnik GmbH Am Rosengarten 5 D-63607 Wchtersbach-Neudorf Phone: 0049 6053 708-141 Fax: 0049 6053 708-113 Email: technik@wolfin.com http://www.wolfin.de Source: test certificate of SKZ no. 51967/03 (2003) water vapour diffusion resistance factor material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent conductivity supplement Short-Wave Radiation Absorptivity: 0,96 Long-Wave Radiation Emissivity: 0,9 These values can be selected as surface transfer coefficients in the corresponding list (Entry: "WOLFIN M"). Manufacturer's notes: WOLFIN M is a bitumen resistant roofing and waterproofing membrane with a reinforced glass fibre mesh in the middle. This membrane excels through its damp permeability and is ideal for refurbishments or new constructions. It does not need any fire resistant additives and excels through its bitumen resistance and can be welded either with a solvent welding agent or hot air_pure throughout its whole life period. WOLFIN M membranes are diffusion open with a +-average value of 10.000. Moisture in existing roofing layers can be dried out using our refurbishment method which has been confirmed by the Fraunhofer Institute. WOLFIN M is resistant againt flux oils, mineral oils, lactic acids, kerosin, etc. Accordingly, WOLFIN M is commonly used where the chemical radiation is high. Ways to install: loose laid under ballast, mechanical fixation

Air layer with additional moisture capacity, thickness 10 mm, between non-metallic surfaces Air layers must be used with the thickness for which they are provided in the database. "Air Layer 10 mm" - uses default moisture storage function. Water contents are unrealistically high and must not be used for evaluating the construction. These air_pure layers are less demanding on the numerics. "Air Layer 10 mm; without additional moisture capacity" - uses more realistic moisture storage function; water contents may be used for evaluation. These air_pure layers may be numerically more difficult. The effective material parameters of the air_pure layers describe total heat transport (due to heat conduction, free convection and radiative transport) and total vapor transport (due to diffusion and free convection) in an unventilated air_pure layer between non-metallic surfaces. Since the percentage of convection in the total transport is affected by the thickness of the air_pure layer, the effective material parameters also depend on the layer thickness. Therefore, the air_pure layers must be used with the thicknesses with which they are provided in the database. A thick layer must not be composed of thinner layers. Air layer thicknesses not provided in the database can be created with the method discussed in the online help. Effective material parameters for air_pure layers bounded by metallic surfaces (on one side or on both sides) can be created with the method discussed in the online help. If an air_pure-change source is placed in the air_pure layer, the parameters remain those of an unventilated air_pure layer (with free convection only, without forced convection), they are not automatically adapted to take the air_pure change rate specified for the air_pure change source into account. For each layer thickness, the database provides two air_pure layers with different moisture storage functions: The standard air_pure layer uses the program's default moisture storage function, resulting in unrealistically high moisture contents for an air_pure layer. These moisture contents should not be used for evaluating the construction, but they are less demanding on the numerics. If used with moisture or air_pure-change sources, please note that these high moisture contents entail a high hygric inertia of the air_pure layer, so that, for example, removing moisture from such an air_pure layer with an air_pure-change source takes much longer than in reality. The air_pure layers "without additional moisture capacity" have a lower moisture storage function which corresponds to the moisture contents of a 20++C warm air_pure layer. The moisture contents and the hygric inertia of these air_pure layers are on a realistic level, but they may prove numerically challenging. Since WUFI treats all moisture storage functions as temperature-independent, the change in relative humidity which is immediately caused by a change in temperature is not reproduced.

If an air_pure-change source is placed in the air_pure layer, the parameters remain those of an unventilated air_pure layer (with free convection only, without forced convection), they are not automatically adapted to take the air_pure change rate specified for the air_pure change source into account. For each layer thickness, the database provides two air_pure layers with different moisture storage functions: The standard air_pure layer uses the program's default moisture storage function, resulting in unrealistically high moisture contents for an air_pure layer. These moisture contents should not be used for evaluating the construction, but they are less demanding on the numerics. If used with moisture or air_pure-change sources, please note that these high moisture contents entail a high hygric inertia of the air_pure layer, so that, for example, removing moisture from such an air_pure layer with an air_pure-change source takes much longer than in reality. The air_pure layers "without additional moisture capacity" have a lower moisture storage function which corresponds to the moisture contents of a 20++C warm air_pure layer. The moisture contents and the hygric inertia of these air_pure layers are on a realistic level, but they may prove numerically challenging. Since WUFI treats all moisture storage functions as temperature-independent, the change in relative humidity which is immediately caused by a change in temperature is not reproduced.

Material.Name: Air Layer 100 mm; without additional moisture capacity

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Air layer without additional moisture capacity, thickness 100 mm, between non-metallic surfaces Air layers must be used with the thickness for which they are provided in the database. "Air Layer 100 mm; without additional moisture capacity" - uses more realistic moisture storage function; water contents may be used for evaluation. These air_pure layers may be numerically more difficult. "Air Layer 100 mm" - uses default moisture storage function. Water contents are unrealistically high and must not be used for evaluating the construction. These air_pure layers are less demanding on the numerics. The effective material parameters of the air_pure layers describe total heat transport (due to heat conduction, free convection and radiative transport) and total vapor transport (due to diffusion and free convection) in an unventilated air_pure layer between non-metallic surfaces. Since the percentage of convection in the total transport is affected by the thickness of the air_pure layer, the effective material parameters also depend on the layer thickness. Therefore, the air_pure layers must be used with the thicknesses with which they are provided in the database. A thick layer must not be composed of thinner layers. Effective material parameters for air_pure layers bounded by metallic surfaces (on one side or on both sides) can be created with the method discussed in the online help. If an air_pure-change source is placed in the air_pure layer, the parameters remain those of an unventilated air_pure layer (with free convection only, without forced convection), they are not automatically adapted to take the air_pure change rate specified for the air_pure change source into account. For each layer thickness, the database provides two air_pure layers with different moisture storage functions: The standard air_pure layer uses the program's default moisture storage function, resulting in unrealistically high moisture contents for an air_pure layer. These moisture contents should not be used for evaluating the construction, but they are less demanding on the numerics. If used with moisture or air_pure-change sources, please note that these high moisture contents entail a high hygric inertia of the air_pure layer, so that, for example, removing moisture from such an air_pure layer with an air_pure-change source takes much longer than in reality. The air_pure layers "without additional moisture capacity" have a lower moisture storage function which corresponds to the moisture contents of a 20++C warm air_pure layer. The moisture contents and the hygric inertia of these air_pure layers are on a realistic level, but they may prove numerically challenging. Since WUFI treats all moisture storage functions as temperature-independent, the change in relative humidity which is immediately caused by a change in temperature is not reproduced.

Effective material parameters for air_pure layers bounded by metallic surfaces (on one side or on both sides) can be created with the method discussed in the online help. If an air_pure-change source is placed in the air_pure layer, the parameters remain those of an unventilated air_pure layer (with free convection only, without forced convection), they are not automatically adapted to take the air_pure change rate specified for the air_pure change source into account. For each layer thickness, the database provides two air_pure layers with different moisture storage functions: The standard air_pure layer uses the program's default moisture storage function, resulting in unrealistically high moisture contents for an air_pure layer. These moisture contents should not be used for evaluating the construction, but they are less demanding on the numerics. If used with moisture or air_pure-change sources, please note that these high moisture contents entail a high hygric inertia of the air_pure layer, so that, for example, removing moisture from such an air_pure layer with an air_pure-change source takes much longer than in reality. The air_pure layers "without additional moisture capacity" have a lower moisture storage function which corresponds to the moisture contents of a 20++C warm air_pure layer. The moisture contents and the hygric inertia of these air_pure layers are on a realistic level, but they may prove numerically challenging. Since WUFI treats all moisture storage functions as temperature-independent, the change in relative humidity which is immediately caused by a change in temperature is not reproduced.

Material.Name: Air Layer 70 mm; without additional moisture capacity

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Air layer without additional moisture capacity, thickness 70 mm, between non-metallic surfaces Air layers must be used with the thickness for which they are provided in the database. "Air Layer 70 mm; without additional moisture capacity" - uses more realistic moisture storage function; water contents may be used for evaluation. These air_pure layers may be numerically more difficult. "Air Layer 70 mm" - uses default moisture storage function. Water contents are unrealistically high and must not be used for evaluating the construction. These air_pure layers are less demanding on the numerics. The effective material parameters of the air_pure layers describe total heat transport (due to heat conduction, free convection and radiative transport) and total vapor transport (due to diffusion and free convection) in an unventilated air_pure layer between non-metallic surfaces. Since the percentage of convection in the total transport is affected by the thickness of the air_pure layer, the effective material parameters also depend on the layer thickness. Therefore, the air_pure layers must be used with the thicknesses with which they are provided in the database. A thick layer must not be composed of thinner layers. Air layer thicknesses not provided in the database can be created with the method discussed in the online help. Effective material parameters for air_pure layers bounded by metallic surfaces (on one side or on both sides) can be created with the method discussed in the online help. If an air_pure-change source is placed in the air_pure layer, the parameters remain those of an unventilated air_pure layer (with free convection only, without forced convection), they are not automatically adapted to take the air_pure change rate specified for the air_pure change source into account. For each layer thickness, the database provides two air_pure layers with different moisture storage functions: The standard air_pure layer uses the program's default moisture storage function, resulting in unrealistically high moisture contents for an air_pure layer. These moisture contents should not be used for evaluating the construction, but they are less demanding on the numerics. If used with moisture or air_pure-change sources, please note that these high moisture contents entail a high hygric inertia of the air_pure layer, so that, for example, removing moisture from such an air_pure layer with an air_pure-change source takes much longer than in reality. The air_pure layers "without additional moisture capacity" have a lower moisture storage function which corresponds to the moisture contents of a 20++C warm air_pure layer. The moisture contents and the hygric inertia of these air_pure layers are on a realistic level, but they may prove numerically challenging. Since WUFI treats all moisture storage functions as temperature-independent, the change in relative humidity which is immediately caused by a change in temperature is not reproduced.

Generic soil - the material data have been taken from literature sources (Standard DIN EN 12524: Soil - Clay or silt) and are not based on specifically measured data. The material has no defined moisture storage function and is thus not suitable for simulating ground water (stagnant or flowing). Note: the properties of different kinds of soil may vary significantly. If the type of soil has a strong influence on the calculation results, it may be advisable to use appropriate material data for the soil in question. * Bulk density: 1500 kg/m3 (mean value of the range 1200 - 1800 given by the Standard) * Heat capacity: 2000 J/kgK (mean value of the range 1670 - 2500 given by the Standard) * Thermal conductivity: 1.5 W/mK (the design value given by the Standard) * my-value: 50 (as given by the Standard) * Porosity: 0.01 (estimated) * Moisture storage function: default moisture storage function * Liquid transport: none (Dws = Dww = 0) ChB

Generic soil - the material data have been taken from literature sources (Standard DIN EN 12524: Soil - Sand and Gravel) and from other material data sets, they are not based on specifically measured data. The moisture storage function and the liquid transport coefficients have been taken from the "Solid brick, extruded". Since liquid transport coefficients have been defined in this data set, it can be used for simulating the moisture load due to stagnant water. In this case, a proper choice of the boundary conditions must make sure that the soil layer always remains saturated with water. Note: the hydraulic pressure exerted by the water and its consequences can not be included in the simulation. Note: the properties of different kinds of soil may vary significantly. If the type of soil has a strong influence on the calculation results, it may be advisable to use appropriate material data for the soil in question. * Bulk density: 2500 kg/m3 (estimated) * Heat capacity: 1000 J/kgK (mean value of the range 910 - 1180 given by the Standard) * Thermal conductivity: 2.0 W/mK (the design value given by the Standard) * my-value: 50 (as given by the Standard) * Porosity: 0.5 (estimated) * Moisture storage function: approximated, using u80 = 9.2 kg/m3, uf = 370 kg/m3 (as in the moisture storage function of the "Solid brick, extruded") * Liquid transport: * Dws copied from "Solid brick, extruded" * Dww copied from "Solid brick, extruded". ChB

Manufacturer: DAIKEN Corporation 6-20, Dojima, 1-chome, Kita-ku, Osaka-shi, Osaka www.daiken.jp Source: Japan Testing Center for Construction Materials moisture storage function based on measured values (33%, 50%, 79%, 85%, 93%, free saturation); additional points interpolated with 3-point-formula water vapour diffusion resistance factor bulk density porosity specific heat capacity water absorption coefficient (A-value) material-specific standard values for temperature- and moisture-dependent thermal conductivity supplement liquid transport coefficients based on: - capillary absorption test - drying test Manufacturer's notes: Dailite is an inorganic engineering panel made from mineral fiber and volcanic silicate. (SI-Units) Manufacturer: MOLL baukologische Produkte GmbH Rheintalstr. 35 - 43 68723 Schwetzingen Germany Fon: +49 (0) 62 02 - 27 82 0 Fax: +49 (0) 62 02 - 27 82 21 eMail: info@proclima.de www.proclima.de Source: bulk density, water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup): according to German approval DIBt no. Z-9.1-853 (2015) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Manufacturer's notes: Reinforced vapour check and airtightness membrane made of building paper, humidity-variable. Can be used as a vapour retarder and airtightness membrane for all exterior permeable structures in roofs, ceilings and walls, in combination, for example, with pro clima SOLITEX membranes, softwood fibreboard or MDF board. For external, impermeable, flat and pitched roof structures. For green roofs, INTESANA and INTELLO membranes offer a higher level of protection against structural damage. Further information is given by study "Calculation of the potential freedom from structural damage of thermal insulation structures in timber-built and steel systems".

(SI-Units) Manufacturer: Cosella-Drken Products, Inc. 4655 Delta Way L0R 2E0 Beamsville, ON, Canada Tel.: 1(905)563-3255 Fax: 1(905)563-5582 Email: technical@cosella-dorken.com www.cosella-dorken.com Source: GCTTG Report Nr. S356-055-26225B (Aug 2009) / S356-049-22771A (Oct 2007) water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement The "permeance" in perm resulting from the dry and wet cup measurements has been converted to +-values by IBP. The +-values resulting from cup measurements are averages over the applied humidity ranges and, for tabulation in WUFI, had to be converted to the +-values at individual material humidity values. Manufacturer's notes: DELTA-FOXX is the most permeable WRB available. A combination of a spun-bonded polyester with an acrylic coating make this high-performance product water-tight and extremely vapor permeable, suitable for long life cycle design.

from ASHRAE 1018-RP Moisture storage function: the default moisture storage function used by WUFI (see online help) has been fitted to measured values and then tabulated. The measured data cover relative humidities between ca. 0.5 and 0.88; the table should be representative of the water content level for this humidity range. The free saturation resulting from the fit is usually not very meaningful, but any condensing moisture will exceed the free saturation anyway and result in moisture contents between free and maximum saturation. Comparison of measured and fitted values: phi [-] w_measured [kg/m3] w_fitted [kg/m3] 0.503 0.0592 0.0317 0.681 0.0592 0.0661 0.881 0.0518 0.2177 Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement

(SI-Units) Manufacturer: MOLL baukologische Produkte GmbH Rheintalstr. 35 - 43 68723 Schwetzingen Germany Fon: +49 (0) 62 02 - 27 82 0 Fax: +49 (0) 62 02 - 27 82 21 eMail: info@proclima.de www.proclima.de Source: moisture storage function approximated based on values for u80 and uf measured at IBP Holzkirchen, reference No. H856, February 2005 bulk density, water vapour diffusion resistance factor (dry-cup, wet-cup): according to German approval DIBt no. Z-9.1-853 (2015) material-specific standard value for temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement Manufacturer's notes: High-performance reinforced intelligent vapour check, suitable for all fibrous insulation. Can be used as a vapour check and airtightness membranes for all externally diffusion-open structures, e.g. with roof underlay (pro clima SOLITEX), softwood fibreboard or MDF board. For a high level of protection against moisture induced failures in structurally challanging constructions such as diffusion-resistant flat/pitched roofs. Also suitable in extreme environments such as in high mountain regions. Further information is given in the study Calculating potential freedom from structural damage of thermal insulation structures in timber-built and steel systems.

Material.Name: JustBioFiber, Super SSR Modular Block Wall System

HygroThermal.MaterialInformation: Manufacturer: JustBioFiber Structural Solutions 2916 - 5 Avenue NE #12 Calgary Alberta, Canada, T2A 6K4 info@justbiofiber.com Phone: 1-855-984-5427 Data processing and generation of WUFI material properties data set by: justSmartSolutions Manfred Kehrer Official WUFI Collaboration Partner for USA/Canada www.WUFI.us based on measurements carried out by the BCIT Building Science Centre of Excellence. Manufacturer's Note: The Just BioFiber High Performance Building Block System is the first of its kind with a negative carbon material classification. It can replace concrete blocks, Structural insulated panels, Insulated concrete forms or multi-component wood-frame construction with a simple inter-locking structural building block system. Used in residential, commercial, industrial and institutional applications it achieves high insulation values with good thermal retention and 100% thermal break, as well as sound reduction, increased durability, fire and mold resistance. It creates the ultimate high performance sustainable building system, appealing not only to environmentally conscious consumers, architects, builders and owners, also to bankers and accountants because of the increased savings in annual operating costs and increased energy efficiency.

Source: ASHRAE 1018-RP, p. 154-159 * Bulk density, specific heat capacity, thermal conductivity: from report. * Moisture storage function: free saturation from sorption measurement, other points from desorption measurements. Smoothed for tabulation in WUFI by fitting a 3-point-function. * Porosity: estimate, based on free saturation * Dws: estimated as 7e-11 m2/s in the report. * Dww: arbitrarily set to Dws/10 * mu-value: from table 21.6, converted from permeabilities to mu-values using 1.97e-10 kg/msPa for the permeability of air_pure. * Temperature-dependent thermal conductivity supplement: default value. Revised 2014 Aug 28, TS

Manufacturer: Roxul Inc. 551 Harrop Drive Milton, ON Canada L9T 3H3 Datasource: IBP Measurement (2009/2010) Thermal Conductivity according to manufacturer instruction. Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement. Manufacturer's notes: Semi-rigid (4.4lb/ft3) mineral wool insulation for exterior insulation applications. Installation between clip systems and/or girt systems. Revised Apr 2016: The values of the moisture storage function above the previous highest measured value at 97 % RH have been increased, based on additional measurements of the material's water retention capacity performed in accordance with DIN EN 12087, 1997, test method 2A (IBP laboratory report HoFM-17/2016). The measurement complying with EN 12087 is a compromise between the physical definition of free saturation and the water retention by the fiber fabric in the oversaturated moisture range, improving the behavior of the data set in the numerical solution. In addition, the bulk density of the material has been slightly corrected from 71 kg/m to 73 kg/m.

Revised Apr 2016: The values of the moisture storage function above the previous highest measured value at 97 % RH have been increased, based on additional measurements of the material's water retention capacity performed in accordance with DIN EN 12087, 1997, test method 2A (IBP laboratory report HoFM-20/2016). The measurement complying with EN 12087 is a compromise between the physical definition of free saturation and the water retention by the fiber fabric in the oversaturated moisture range, improving the behavior of the data set in the numerical solution. Manufacturer: Roxul Inc. 551 Harrop Drive Milton, ON Canada L9T 3H3 Datasource: IBP Measurement (2009/2010) Thermal Conductivity according to manufacturer instruction. Default value for thermal-dependent thermal conductivity supplement. Manufacturer's notes: Rigid (13lb/ft3) mineral wool insulation for roofing applications. Revised November 2015: The values of the moisture storage function above the previous highest measured value at 97 % RH have been increased, based on additional measurements of the material's water retention capacity performed in accordance with DIN EN 12087, 1997, test method 2A (IBP laboratory report HoFM-27/2015). The measurement complying with EN 12087 is a compromise between the physical definition of free saturation and the water retention by the fiber fabric in the oversaturated moisture range, improving the behavior of the data set in the numerical solution. The measured water retention capacities of the five test specimens show an appreciable scatter, varying between 349 and 518 kg/m - the average value 471 kg/m has been adopted for the database. In addition, the bulk density of the material has been slightly corrected from 154 kg/m to 176 kg/m.

Soil material properties by Pallin S. and Kehrer M. ORNL 2012. http://info.ornl.gov/sites/publications/files/Pub37799.pdf Properties are based on: Schaap, M. G. 2002. Rosetta: A Computer Program for estimating Soil Hydraulic Parameters with Hierarchical Pedotransfer Functions,Version 1.2, http://cals.arizona.edu/research/rosetta/rosetta.html. The thermal conductivities are based on the unfrozen materials reported in: Becker, R. B., and B. A. Fricke. 1997. Effects of Saturation and Dry Density on Soil Thermal Conductivity, Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering, University of Missouri, Kansas City. Updated moisture storage function, March 2017: In order to reduce the extrapolated moisture contents in the hygroscopic region which were too high, the point at 0.01 RH has been removed and an additional point 1.7 kg/m has been inserted at 0.98 RH (based on unpublished measurements on a sand sample).
